> With a nod to Legacy Santon gave the order, and legacy pulled a
> switch,=
 and =A0almost immediately Tuscon's world began to swirl as
> colors and so=
unds hit against him . . .

Tuscon found himself standing on what would app=
ear to be a street on
some highly technological world, perhaps even old Cyb=
ertron. His
powerful sense of hearing could pick up the locations of many
s=
tructures around him. However that in itself wasn't even necessary,
because=
 Tuscon could SEE. He could see high rise buildings, power
plants, research=
 buildings and many other things, but none of them was
anything that he rec=
ognized.

The air smelled a bit stale with the hint of different metals and=

such, and the building seemed to be well maintained although dark as
if po=
wered down. The most obvious detail was the one that might take
the most ti=
me to pick up on, there didn't appear to be any life around
him, techologic=
al or biological, Tuscon appeared to be totally alone.
Only empty streets g=
reeted his sight as breezes blew around small bits
of debris.

That was whe=
n in the distance he could hear the Rodimus' voice, "Help
me Tuscon!"

(TAG=
)

Preston
